intro: Pedicularis parryi subsp. purpurea, commonly known as the purple monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive hooded shape. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. The subspecies purpurea is distinguished by its more vibrant floral coloration compared to other subspecies of Pedicularis.
